title-group.article-title: General Motors High Performance 4.3L V6 Engine

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1993 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: The 200 HP high performance 4.3L Vortec V6 engine has been developed to satisfy the need for a fuel efficient performance powerplant in the General Motors small truck platforms. Marketing requirements included strong low and mid range torque, relatively high specific power, smoothness and noise comparable to the best competitive six cylinder engines, excellent driveability, and a new technology image. Maintaining the 4.3L engine record of high reliability and customer satisfaction was an absolute requirement. Fuel economy and exhaust emission performance had to meet expected customer and legislated requirements in the mid 1990's.

ref.mixed-citation: Walker, J. W.; Wiltse, R. F.; Harhaus, V. W.; The GM 4.3 liter V-6 Gasoline Engine; SAE Paper 841225; presented to the Passenger Car Meeting, October, 1994
Harhaus; V. W.; Pocobello, M.; Tenkel, F. G.; The Turbo /Intercooled Syclone Engine; SAE Paper 910682; presented to the SAE International Congress and Exposition, February, 1991
Kazarinoff, Dimitri N.; Residual Combustion -Gas Backflow in a Port Fuel Injected Spark Ignition Engine; Massachusetts Institute of Technology, June, 1985

Pozniak, D. J.; Rydzewski, J. S.; A study of In-Cylinder Air Motion in the General Motors VORTEC 4.3L, V-6 engine; SAE Paper 850510; presented to the SAE International Congress and Exposition, February 25-March 1, 1985
